repnme.cdata!:
Nicaragua - Programmatic Structural
            Adjustment Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Within the context of the Country
            Assistance Strategy (CAS), the Programmatic Structural
            Adjustment Credit (PSAC) Project will support implementation
            of the country's Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper
            (PRSP), by addressing key structural obstacles to poverty
            reduction, and assist Nicaragua with the urgent need to
            strengthen its depleted international reserves position,
            meet the agreed macroeconomic targets, and help reduce the
            country's vulnerability to a possible balance of
            payments crisis. As the analytical and sector work advances,
            future adjustment lending to the country in support of the
            PRSP, would take the form of a series of Poverty Reduction
            Strategy Credit Projects.

repnme.cdata!:
Nicaragua - Programmatic Structural
            Adjustment Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Programmatic Structural Adjustment
            Credit (PSAC) Project will support implementation of the
            country's Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper (PRSP), by
            addressing key structural obstacles to poverty reduction,
            and assist Nicaragua with the urgent need to strengthen its
            depleted international reserves position, meet the agreed
            macroeconomic targets, and help reduce the country's
            vulnerability to a possible balance of payments crisis.
            This PSAC gives particular attention to the first, second,
            and fourth pillars of the PRSP, responding to the
            government's emphasis on the urgent need to accelerate
            economic growth, build the country's human resource
            base and improve governance. Within the first pillar, the
            PSAC emphasizes measures and policies to improve the private
            investment climate, especially to attract foreign direct
            investment and on strengthening the financial system,
            including the regulatory environment for micro-finance
            institutions.  The project will support the second pillar of
            the PRSP by focusing on measures to raise the coverage and
            quality of primary education, increase the coverage and
            quality of basic health services, especially in rural areas,
            improve child nutrition indicators, increase the coverage of
            water and sanitation services, and strengthen reproductive
            health programs.  Within the fourth pillar, the project
            emphasizes measures to improve transparency and strengthen
            public expenditure management.
